p: Concerning T. zygis EO, the MIC values ranged from 0.39 mg/mL to 0.78 mg/mL, while the MBC value was 3.125 mg/mL. However, The MIC values of R. officinalis varied from 0.78 mg/mL to 1.56 mg/mL, but the MBC value was 12.5 mg/mL. Compared to O. majorana and R. officinalis, T. zygis EO showed the greatest antibacterial activity against MRSA isolates. Person correlation (r) showed no significant correlation between the type of specimen and MICs of oils ( p > 0.05).
